intro: Peucedanum schiwerekii, commonly known as the Schiwerek's angelica, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, where it thrives in rocky and alpine environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring finely divided, bluish-green leaves. Its flowers, which bloom in late summer, are small and white, arranged in umbrella-like clusters. The roots of Peucedanum schiwerekii are often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
